Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English, with French, German, Spanish, and Italian.

did.abstract: Geologist. Diaries and field notes, letterbooks, correspondence, family papers, subject files, photographs, printed matter, and miscellaneous material relating chiefly to Emmons's family and his career as a geologist.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

persname.part: Bartlett, Suzanne Earle Ogden-Jones Emmons, 1861-1954. Suzanne Earle Ogden-Jones Emmons Bartlett papers. 1897-1913.
Markoe, Sophie D. Sophie D. Markoe papers. 1852-1911.

corpname.part: United States Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel (1867-1881)

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Samuel Franklin Emmons, geologist, were given to the Library of Congress by his widow, Suzanne Earle Ogden-Jones Emmons Bartlett, in 1947-1948, following a fire in the facility where the papers had been stored that damaged a considerable amount of the material. In 1958, her daughter, Mrs. Armistead Peter III, gave additional papers from her mother's estate.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: In 1959, the Emmons Papers were housed and a shelf list was prepared. In 1981, papers relating to Paul W. Bartlett and Bessie McPherson were transferred from this collection to a separate collection of Paul W. Bartlett Papers. The Emmons Papers were rehoused and reorganized in 2006. The finding aid was revised in 2012.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of Samuel Franklin Emmons in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Samuel Franklin Emmons are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

altformavail.head: Microfilm
altformavail.p: A microfilm edition of part of these papers is available on one reel. Consult reference staff in the Manuscript Division concerning availability for purchase or interlibrary loan. To promote preservation of the originals, researchers are required to consult the microfilm edition as available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container or reel number, Samuel Franklin Emmons Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Samuel Franklin Emmons (1841-1911) span the years 1725-1913, with the bulk of the material concentrated in the period 1861-1911. The collection consists of diaries and field notes, letterbooks, correspondence, family papers, subject files, financial records, photographs, printed matter, and scrapbooks. Some material is in French, German, Spanish, and Italian. The collection was damaged by fire and water prior to being received by the Library and much of it is in fragile or decayed condition.

The papers treat Emmons's education, personal life, and business ventures, but the focus is on his explorations in the western United States, on geological formations and mines and mining, and on the United States Geological Survey that Emmons cofounded with Clarence King (1842-1901). Prominent in the collection are files pertaining to the United States Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel, 1867-1876. There is considerable family material, including correspondence with his uncle, N. Henry Evans, and papers relating to his wives, Sophie D. Markoe and Suzanne Earle Odgen-Jones Emmons Bartlett.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in nine series:

item.ref: Suzanne Earle Ogden-Jones Emmons Bartlett Papers, 1897-1914

arrangement.p: Diaries are arranged chronologically. Field notes are arranged by expedition.

emph.emph: Diary of 1872 is available on microfilm. Shelf no. 16,978

scopecontent.p: General letterbooks containing copies of incoming and outgoing correspondence on business, financial, and legal matters.

arrangement.p: General letterbooks are arranged chronologically. Letterbook for the New Pedrara Onyx Co. and an index are filed at the end of the series.

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received by Emmons and family members.

arrangement.p: Correspondence of Samuel Franklin Emmons is arranged chronologically. Correspondence of other Emmons family members is arranged alphabetically by name of family member.

did.unittitle: Incomplete letters and loose pages, 1884-1910, undated

scopecontent.p: Expense records, account books, ledgers, and miscellany.

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of material and chronologically thereunder.

scopecontent.p: Reports and writings, printed matter, photographs, educational and training materials, financial and legal records, congressional hearing records, commemorative material, address and appointment books, genealogical and social records, drawings and music.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by type of material or topic.

did.unittitle: Diamond Discovery of 1872 , by Emmons, undated
Office of the Chief of Engineers

scopecontent.p: Autographs, quotations, and birthday greetings collected by Markoe and her correspondence, diary, financial records, and society notices.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by type of material or topic.

did.unittitle: Suzanne Earle Ogden-Jones Emmons Bartlett Papers, 1897-1914

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, financial records, calling cards, invitations, and miscellany.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by type of material.

scopecontent.p: One volume covers the United States Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel with general volumes and newspaper clippings.

arrangement.p: General volumes and newspaper clippings are arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: United States Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel, 1871-1879

scopecontent.p: Drawings, genealogical notes, maps, photographs, and a presidential proclamation.

arrangement.p: Arranged and described according to the series and folders from which the items were removed.
